name: Introduction to Ancient Philosophy
description: This course provides an introduction to the Ancient Greek and Roman philosophical traditions. Topics include the Pre-Socratics, Socrates, Plato, Aristotle, and the Hellenistic philosophers. It includes an overview of Ancient Greek and Latin philosophical texts.

name: Ancient Greek and Latin Language
description: This course provides an introduction to Ancient Greek and Latin language and literature. It covers basic grammar, syntax, and vocabulary. It also introduces the student to a selection of major works from the Ancient Greek and Latin literary traditions.

name: Advanced Ancient Greek and Latin Language
description: This course builds on the basic language skills developed in the introductory course. It covers more advanced grammar and syntax, as well as introducing the student to a selection of more advanced works from the Ancient Greek and Latin literary traditions.

name: Advanced Ancient Philosophy
description: This course provides a more in-depth exploration of the Ancient Greek and Roman philosophical traditions. It expands on the topics covered in the introductory course and includes a more detailed examination of Ancient Greek and Latin philosophical texts.
prerequisites: Advanced Ancient Greek and Latin Language
